Hi Rica, I am hoping to get these pages live by tonight - if not can you let me know when they may be ready? It looks like there is no content on the Pilates page? Background Pilates, as a form of exercise, is based on the work of Joseph Pilates. The three key pillars of Pilates are: 1. Breath 2. Whole-body health 3. Whole-body commitment It is in the honoring of the Pilates principles that the depth of the work is achieved. These Principles are traditionally cited as:
  • Breath
  • Concentration
  • Centring
  • Control
  • Precision
  • Flow
Pull out your gym mat and get ready to do a series of movements that will stabilize and strengthen your core. The moves may look simple, but they take a lot of precision and control. You workout to your level, different options are provided. The workout is usually demanding but doesn't necessarily build up a sweat. There is a strong emphasis on technique and breath. During the exercises you should feel the muscles working hard. You'll get stronger, more sculpted, evenly developed muscles and gain flexibility. You may also have better posture and a better sense of well-being. Pilates can help with back pain and other weaknesses/injuries. Brendan McGovern Clinic Director, Principal Physiotherapist BSc Human Kinetics / MSc Physiotherapy P | 02 8021 2180 F | 02 4044 0265 A | 73 Mullens Street, Balmain NSW 2041 Book Appointment Online
